<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceentry">PrettyStackTraceEntry</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceentry">PrettyStackTraceEntry</a> - This class is used to represent a frame of the &quot;pretty&quot; stack trace that is dumped when a program crashes. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceentry/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktracestring">PrettyStackTraceString</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktracestring">PrettyStackTraceString</a> - This object prints a specified string (which should not contain newlines) to the stream as the stack trace when a crash occurs. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktracestring/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceformat">PrettyStackTraceFormat</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceformat">PrettyStackTraceFormat</a> - This object prints a string (which may use printf-style formatting but should not contain newlines) to the stream as the stack trace when a crash occurs. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceformat/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceprogram">PrettyStackTraceProgram</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceprogram">PrettyStackTraceProgram</a> - This object prints a specified program arguments to the stream as the stack trace when a crash occurs. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/prettystacktraceprogram/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PrettyStackTraceEntry - This class is used to represent a frame of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &quot;pretty&quot; stack trace that is dumped when a program crashes. You can define</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// subclasses of this and declare them on the program stack: when they are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// constructed and destructed, they will add their symbolic frames to a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// virtual stack trace.  This gets dumped out if the program crashes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns the topmost element of the &quot;pretty&quot; stack state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a91d84a6ad314d93eb88033ed8e5886a4">SavePrettyStackState</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Restores the topmost element of the &quot;pretty&quot; stack state to State, which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should come from a previous call to SavePrettyStackState().  This is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// useful when using a CrashRecoveryContext in code that also uses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PrettyStackTraceEntries, to make sure the stack that&#39;s printed if a crash</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// happens after a crash that&#39;s been recovered by CrashRecoveryContext</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// doesn&#39;t have frames on it that were added in code unwound by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CrashRecoveryContext.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
